image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: The number of people in custody has surged dramatically in the Northern Territory since the government passed sweeping bail and justice reforms in 2024.

title.children: UN blocked from inspecting crammed NT prisons

image.altText: An aerial view of a fracking exploration site in the Beetaloo Basin.

props.synopsis: The gas-rich Beetaloo Basin in the Northern Territory has been in development for years — now, the NT government says the gas will finally flow from 2026.

title.children: Fracked gas to enter NT energy market by 2026 to 'keep the lights on'

image.altText: Cow walking through door of home

props.synopsis: An NT resident tells of discovering he had unexpected guests in his home, after his dogs were filmed nudging open a door and letting inside a pet bull and horse.

title.children: Pet camera captures bull and horse sneaking into NT politician's home

image.altText: A corridor of empty prison cells.

props.synopsis: Senior corrections and health staff will change how they respond to health emergencies inside NT jails, following the coronial inquest into the death of a disabled prisoner.

title.children: Corrections, health staff commit to change after grandfather's death in prison

image.altText: A picture of two septic tanks with lids off in a remote community backyard.

props.synopsis: A coroner's report has found there were multiple missed opportunities to improve or replace the public housing septic system, which the NT government had responsibility for.

title.children: Toddler's septic tank death 'likely would have been prevented' with maintenance

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: The announcement from NT police follows a months-long ABC investigation into the disappearance of a Yolŋu clan leader who vanished without a trace after being acquitted of murdering a police officer.

title.children: Police restart cold case investigation 90 years after clan leader's disappearance

image.altText: A man dressed in a Santa suit sits on a chair and is swamped by a mob of children.

props.synopsis: Santa Claus had a busy weekend in Alice Springs, with three community events celebrating the festive season.

title.children: Outback town pulls out all stops to celebrate Christmas and community

image.altText: A teacher holds her finger to her lips to hush the children sitting before her on the ground. Two young women sit on the ground.

props.synopsis: A course offered for the first time this year has upskilled home tutors working on remote central Australian cattle stations in a bid to ease education workforce shortages in the outback.

title.children: Plan to keep home tutors at remote NT stations passes the test

image.altText: Woman with head in hands with tax return on screen in the background.

props.synopsis: Perpetrators of financial abuse commit fraud by impersonating their partners, making them company directors in secret and putting business and tax debts in their names. The government wants to fix the problem, but will its proposed reforms go far enough?

title.children: 'How am I going to clear my name?' Debt swamps victims of secret fraud

image.altText: Drone shot looking straight down at a wind turbine and its shadow across a green field

props.synopsis: Soaring costs and trenchant criticism from some put the brakes on wind and transmission as the sun shines on big solar and batteries.

title.children: Energy blueprint shake-up as 'market moves faster than the systems plan'

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired woman in a branded polo shirt stands beneath the awning of a building.

props.synopsis: Only 15.6 per cent of national child protection funding goes towards family support services aimed at keeping families intact, a report has found. Advocates are urging the government to "invest in families, not crisis".

title.children: 'Obscene': More spent on removing kids than intervening early, report finds

image.altText: St Helens bushfire 9 December 2025

props.synopsis: At least two properties have been destroyed in a bushfire burning near St Helens, on Tasmania's upper east coast.

title.children: Houses destroyed as firefighters battle bushfire in Tasmania's east

image.altText: a pot of honey in a bush setting.

props.synopsis: Australian beekeepers are funding their own investigation into the authenticity of imported honey, with tests showing other products are being added.

title.children: Beekeepers pay for imported honey testing to uncover hidden additives

image.altText: Beenleigh shooting scene

props.synopsis: Police have now laid charges over a fatal shooting in Beenleigh, south of Brisbane, earlier this month which claimed the life of a 35-year-old man.

title.children: Man found 'hiding underwater' after fatal shooting charged with murder

image.altText: A gorilla that looks like it's stomping with its foot up

props.synopsis: The winning images pair talented nature photography with humour that often relies on capturing a moment at just the right time.

title.children: Dancing gorilla wins funniest wildlife photo of the year

image.altText: Picture of Sydney solicitor Sylvan Singh

props.synopsis: Solicitor Sylvan Singh, 26, is due to face a Sydney bail court on Wednesday morning after being arrested on Tuesday.

title.children: Sydney lawyer shot in gangland attack charged with attempted drug importation

image.altText: Little Simz wears a blue, check blazer and looks into the camera as she crouches down.

props.synopsis: It's been an incredible year of music. Did your favourite album of 2025 make our list?

title.children: The 50 best albums of 2025: Your ultimate year-end music guide

image.altText: A screen showing an avatar of Kim Kardashian with her hair pulled back, dressed in black

props.synopsis: Can you tell what's real and what's fake online? Data Dreams: Art and AI at the MCA looks at truth, art and history in the AI age.

title.children: 'Reality is fiction': New exhibition explores truth in the AI age

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses and a suit jacket.

props.synopsis: Former defence minister Linda Reynolds says Coalition colleagues failed her and she will not stop fighting to clear her name against "lies", no matter the cost.

title.children: 'Despicable and cruel': Reynolds launches scathing attack on government

image.altText: The scull of a dinosaur, positioned under spotlights.

props.synopsis: An ultra-rare dinosaur skeleton is being auctioned in London this week, sparking debate about the ethics of selling specimens with scientific value.

title.children: Dinosaur 'like nothing seen before' for sale and some scientists are angry

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: The latest target of Elon Musk's ire is the European Union, which he has called a "bureaucratic monster" that "should be abolished". So, what's going on?

title.children: Why is Elon Musk in a war of words with the European Union?

image.altText: Donald Trump sits down for an interview.

props.synopsis: The US president hints he could walk away from supporting Ukraine and suggests the nation could cede territory to Moscow because "Russia has the upper hand".

title.children: Trump criticises 'decaying' Europe and says 'size will win' in Ukraine

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell in a white shirt, grinning at the camera

props.synopsis: The judge grants the Justice Department's request under a new law requiring the release of files related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

title.children: US judge clears release of grand jury documents against Ghislaine Maxwell

image.altText: Long rows of machines stretching into the distance at a Microsoft data center

props.synopsis: Australia has more than 250 data centres and more in the pipeline, prompting experts to warn against using drinking water to cool servers.

title.children: What we know about water use of the over 250 data centres in Australia

image.altText: A man looking concerned, wearing a black mask, white shirt and orange blazer.

props.synopsis: Lamar Ahchee was arrested in Bali in May after Indonesian police tracked the delivery of two packages containing cocaine to his apartment.

title.children: Australian man accused of smuggling cocaine tells Bali court he was 'coerced'

image.altText: A group of men sit on the back of a truck at night, some holding guns

props.synopsis: More than 140,000 civilians have been evacuated from border regions since fresh fighting between Thailand and Cambodia began on Sunday, officials said.

title.children: Thousands forced to flee as Thailand-Cambodia border clashes spread

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says his country is ready to move forward with a US-backed peace proposal.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's initial proposal to end the war was judged by Ukraine's allies to be overly favourable to Russia.

title.children: Ukraine to send US revised peace plan as Zelenskyy rules out ceding territory

image.altText: A group of officers wearing light blue unfiroms stand, they carry posters reading 'underpaid, understaffed, unsafe'

props.synopsis: The union representing correctional officers has voted to strike indefinitely, while officers who monitor 1,500 people on home detention will stop work for 24 hours

title.children: SA prisons remain locked down indefinitely, as home detention officers step off job

image.altText: a building with security gates at night time

props.synopsis: A WA District Court judge questions how family and domestic violence perpetrators were able to "persistently" contact their victims using a regional prison's phones.

title.children: Violent offenders used prison phones to call victim-survivors

image.altText: Arne Slot shakes hands and winks with Florian Wirtz

props.synopsis: Liverpool coach Arne Slot picks up a crucial win against Inter Milan with his tenure on shaky ground amid a public fallout with his star winger Mohamed Salah.

title.children: Liverpool boss says 'everyone makes mistakes' after win amid Salah spat

image.altText: Helmut Marko and Max Verstappen smiling together.

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen reacts as Helmut Marko's retirement leaves Red Bull without its two main guiding personalities since its entry into F1.

title.children: 'Forever grateful' Verstappen pays tribute to retiring Red Bull icon

image.altText: GettyImages-2248627901

props.synopsis: The Indianapolis Colts reportedly sign Philip Rivers to play at quarterback, four years after his retirement from the NFL.

title.children: NFL team turns to retired grandfather to play quarterback due to injury crisis

image.altText: GettyImages-2250174745

props.synopsis: A human rights organisation files an official complaint to FIFA over its peace prize awarded to US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Complaint filed over FIFA's 'egregious abuse of power' with Trump award

image.altText: Two men hold a small ball each.

props.synopsis: Karen and Karenni refugees in central Victoria are taking a traditional sport to the world championships and staying connected in the process.

title.children: Refugees keep sport of sepak takraw alive and kicking in Bendigo

image.altText: A crowd of hundreds of people gathered outside a lit-up stadium

props.synopsis:
Some Lady Gaga fans have reported queuing for hours in a disorganised manner to try and and enter the star's Brisbane show on Tuesday night.

Lang Park said "technical issues" delayed the gates opening, which caused a backlog of people queuing in the heat.

A spokesperson for the stadium said it would perform an "extensive debrief" with stakeholders in the coming days.

title.children: Fans face mayhem trying to get into Brisbane Lady Gaga concert
